comments:
This is Callisto 3.2 without C/C++ + EMF Sourcecode Plugin
Mac OS X 10.4.6
java version "1.5.0_06"
Java(TM) 2 Runtime Environment, Standard Edition (build 1.5.0_06-111)
Java HotSpot(TM) Client VM (build 1.5.0_06-64, mixed mode, sharing)


Im in my .genmodel an Click on Generator -> Reload...
I select (again) my .ecore model
the NPE occurs after the click on finish.


.log:
Caused by: java.lang.NullPointerException
	at org.eclipse.emf.codegen.ecore.genmodel.impl.GenFeatureImpl.reconcile(GenFeatureImpl.java:1695)
	at org.eclipse.emf.codegen.ecore.genmodel.impl.GenClassImpl.reconcile(GenClassImpl.java:2116)
	at org.eclipse.emf.codegen.ecore.genmodel.impl.GenPackageImpl.reconcile(GenPackageImpl.java:3515)
	at org.eclipse.emf.codegen.ecore.genmodel.impl.GenModelImpl.reconcile(GenModelImpl.java:6284)
	at org.eclipse.emf.importer.ModelImporter.prepareGenModelAndEPackages(ModelImporter.java:673)
	at org.eclipse.emf.importer.ui.contribution.base.ModelImporterWizard.doPerformFinish(ModelImporterWizard.java:148)
	at org.eclipse.emf.converter.ui.contribution.base.ModelConverterWizard$1.execute(ModelConverterWizard.java:223)
	... 53 more


To find the problem, I started Eclipse itself in the debugger and reproduced the problem.
While in the Reload... Wizard, reconcile is called 3 times. The NPE happens the third time after pressing the finish button.

In the screenshot, you see that this.ecoreFeature.name is null and reconcile calls getEcoreFeature().getName().equals(oldGenFeatureVersion.getEcoreFeature().getName())  which causes the NPE.

I see several problem:
- reconcile doesn't handle the null name correctly.
- Validate on .ecore and on .genmodel don't find any problems


it might or might not be interesting that generating the .genmodel did overwrite the package name in the .ecore model (set the name to 'model').

Is there a workaround? Where do I have to set the name?

Created an attachment (id=47427)
NPE in the debugger
correction: reconcile is called only once.

I found the null in the .ecore that caused this NPE.
It would be very nice if validate would find this.

We'll diagnose poorly formed names as part of the Ecore constraint validation work.

*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 75933 ***
